content: Are there no Vietnam heros? Every day there are several Iraq heros, complete with new and better benefits. I don't get it. I know it is war, but what makes these servicemen such heros. I would never steal a combat veteran's thunder, Ialways make it clear I was a jet mechanic and give the combat guys their due. By the way, I wore my Vidtnam veteran hat to my new job a Kroger on Veteran's Day and low and behold I was fired for it. Not a veteran friendly employer. I helped stock a new store and one day after it opened I was let go. Can't quite figure out what happened so I guess it was the fact that I did on wear my Kroger hat. I have a Navy buddy that was spit on in the San Francisco airport. Too bad the media could not portray us in a better light. Heros? The KIA's are the heros, not every one that serves. BS!! WW II veterans were heros, not much mention of them anymore, but at least they did get parades. We ran the gauntlet like prisoners and tried to get back into the good old American mainstream. I am sick of hearing of all these heros. I am respectful of them but they are not all heros. How about a draft for some of these punks running the streets dealing drugs, shooting people, robbing old people, etc. This could go on forever.

title: Christopher Clark

content: It takes everyone to keep wheels of the war wagon turning. Everyone has a job and if a clerk fires his weapon on a base bunker line he may earn a medal for going above and beyond the call of duty, where as in the infantry it’s just another day at work. I think a lot of public support and declaring Iraq vets as heroes is because of the amends being made for the way the VN veterans were treated. Of course I think all veterans should deserve a hero’s recognition. You shouldn’t have lost your job for wearing your colors on Veterans Day and I can’t understand your employer’s attitude. How long ago did it happen ? If someone had spit on me when I returned from VN like they did your navy buddy one of us would have had a very bad day !
reply: It takes everyone to keep wheels of the war wagon turning. content: MOD HAT OFF quote: Originally posted by 67NOV: quote: Originally posted by 12222909: How about a draft for some of these punks running the streets dealing drugs, shooting people, robbing old people, etc. This could go on forever. Would you want these types watching your back??? Don't wish 'em on someone else. Bingo! The only use I can think of for those types if they were drafted is if they were used to scrape the barnacles off the keel of a carrier...while underway at flank speed! "I've a good mind to join a club and beat you over the head with it."--Groucho Marx

content: The OP’s profile shows that he has two (2) I think, I hope it is just an error in selecting his ribbons for his profile. Defense Distinguished Service Medal The Defense Distinguished Service Medal (DDSM) was established by Executive Order 11545, 9 July 1970. It is awarded by the Secretary of Defense to officers of the Armed Forces of the United States whose exceptional performance of duty and contributions to national security or defense have been at the highest levels. The prescribing directive for the DDSM is DOD 1348.33-M. (Manual of Military Decorations and Awards). This award is the highest not combat ward that can be given. Often seen as a retirement award for O6 and above God and the soldier, All men adore, In time of trouble, And no more; For when war is over, And all things righted, God is neglected - The old soldier slighted. Founding Member Original DVG & Proud Member, Rupterd Duck/Derelict Veterans

title: Christopher Clark

content: “Are there no Vietnam Heroes?” IMHO…EVERY SINGLE… Army, Marine, Air force, Navy, Coast Guard, person that went to VN is a Hero! From the Grunt, Tanker, Cook, (jet)Mechanic, Medic, MP….any and ALL MOS’s. Doing an impossible job/mission for a Government that sent them. As you know VN was an unpopular war. You had the draft, you had hippies, you had draft dodgers, you had the 60’s,…(lol) Now, you have an attack on American soil, you have an all volunteer force, you have families of VN who have long memories…you have Military leadership now, that was in VN or were trained by VN Vets, that KNOW what that was like and the mistakes that were made! Did you ever stop to think… The Pilot that flew the aircraft that you worked on was thankful that YOU and others worked on his plane. That his family was grateful that he was able to “go back to the world” because of you? He might not have said it too often…but I’ll bet every time he landed safely he said some kind of silent thanks or a prayer of thanks…. “Every day there are several Iraq heroes, complete with new and better benefits.” Maybe that’s because during VN, news crews didn’t have satellites available to beam the action straight to our TVs. Millions of Millions of families from the VN era are now Parents and Grandparents, Aunts, Uncles, Brothers and Sisters to those in the Military now, and they remember how the Viet Nam Vet was treated when they came home… Benefits…I have mine because WWII, Korean, Viet Nam Veterans fought for ME and all the vets to get them. They just don’t fall from the government’s money tree. DAV, AMVES…these orgs…”http://www1.va.gov/VSO/index.cfm?template=view” “I don't get it. I know it is war, but what makes these servicemen such Hero’s.” The American people! “We ran the gauntlet like prisoners and tried to get back into the good old American mainstream. I am sick of hearing of all these Hero’s.” An unpopular war… VS. GWOT…. “How about a draft for some of these punks running the streets dealing drugs, shooting people, robbing old people, etc.” Like any of our Soldiers deserve having the above covering their six! Would you? Christopher Clark….I would like to thank you for your service to OUR COUNTRY! From a DS/DS, OIF I Veteran Break glass…in case of Emergency! Or, just wait till I get to the bottom of the bottle!

content: Chris, I would not want one of those scum bags backing me up. The best place for them is a life term in prison doing hard labor! Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!
